segments.text: Come in , Arnold . Have a seat .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Good morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Would you like something to drink ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , thank you . I just had two cups of coffee at my desk .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , you're a serious coffee drinker .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it keeps me going . Sometimes I think I'm addicted .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , coffee isn't such a bad thing.Everyone has to have something.For me , it's cigars . Are you a cigar smoker ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I've tried them . But I'm not really a smoker .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , what would you like to talk to me about ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I wanted to set up this meeting with you to discuss a little proposal .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm glad when people have new ideas around here . Tell me about it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It is about the staff meetings.You know how we have a staff meeting every Tuesday .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I have been thinking about it.And I believe we could do things more efficiently here .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What do you suggest ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The way it is now , the staff from all four branches get together once a week.We meet for one hour . But I think a lot of time is wasted in transportation .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean because people have to go across town to get here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . Some people spend half of the morning on the road .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's true . But our staff meetings are very important , Arnold . I don't know how we can function without them .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think they are important too.That ' s why I want people to have a better attitude about them .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know a lot of people think the meetings aren't too useful . I'm aware of that .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Here's what I propose . I think we should meet once every two weeks , but meet for ninety minutes or more .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I also think the meetings should be more focused.And I would be willing to take responsibility for that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean you want to run the meetings ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , not really run them . But I could help organize them . I could discuss meeting topics with you , and then prepare a schedule for each meeting . I could then send an e-mail to all the staff to explain the coming meeting.This way the meetings would become more focused , and people would prepare better .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hmm . But we would meet every two weeks .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I really think it would work.The meetings could be longer , and better organized .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am not against the idea , Arnold.It may really be more efficient , as you say . I'll tell you what we can do.Why don't we try your proposal for a month , and see how it works .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Excellent . I would be happy to get started on it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I will call the managers.Then tomorrow I'll tell you when we can schedule our first meeting in this " new style . "
segments.speaker: S1
